>>19433424
>I wonder how standard that is in corporate vtuber contracts.
Non-compete clauses are pretty common, but if you're working as a singular entity there's not really much you can do as a competitor to a large company, so they look the other way unless it severely cuts into your time. But most bigger vtubers who do this make money hand over fist as a corporate entity so they'll never touch their past lives again until they retire, for the most part. It's a person-by-person basis.
